content.description: On a given day, the proportion of workers from Company B who purchase a coffee from the company cafeteria is 0.62 and the proportion of workers from Company C who purchase a coffee from the company cafeteria is 0.71. A random sample of40 workers was selected from Company B and another random sample of 40 workers was selected from Company C. The proportion of workers from Company B who purchased coffee was <math alttext="p hat sub B equals 0.70" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.70</mn></mrow></math> and the proportion of workers from Company C who purchased coffee was <math alttext="p hat sub C equals 0.75 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.75</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: What is the correct unit of measure for the mean of the sampling distribution of <math alttext="p hat sub B, end sub, minus p hat sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>âˆ’</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: There are no units associated with the mean of the sampling distribution.

content.answer: There are no units associated with the mean of the sampling distribution.

topic.text: 5.6: Sampling Distributions for Differences in Sample Proportions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
